body:
Instead of adding default arguments to RecordRecvTensor, can you keep RecordRecvTensor as-is, and add a new method called "RecordDataTransfer()" that takes the additional (mandatory) arguments?

(Two motivations here: (i) we don't use default args very much in the codebase, and (ii) if you can change "RecvTensor" to something else, it's not really recording a "RecvTensor".)
body_html:
Instead of adding default arguments to RecordRecvTensor, can you keep RecordRecvTensor as-is, and add a new method called "RecordDataTransfer()" that takes the additional (mandatory) arguments?

(Two motivations here: (i) we don't use default args very much in the codebase, and (ii) if you can change "RecvTensor" to something else, it's not really recording a "RecvTensor".)
body_text:
Instead of adding default arguments to RecordRecvTensor, can you keep RecordRecvTensor as-is, and add a new method called "RecordDataTransfer()" that takes the additional (mandatory) arguments?
(Two motivations here: (i) we don't use default args very much in the codebase, and (ii) if you can change "RecvTensor" to something else, it's not really recording a "RecvTensor".)
